medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began three weeks prior to admission with right retro-orbital and frontal pain, graded 2 to 3 on a scale of 1 to 10, occurring two to three times weekly and lasting one to two hours, relieved by ibuprofen. No positional features were noted and the pain did not occur in the morning. The patient noted visual changes eight days before admission while looking at the night sky, specifically an inability to see stars well with the right eye and diplopia during downward and leftward gaze.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A cough and a temperature of up to 40Â°C were noted six to eight weeks before admission, with a diagnosis of Lyme disease considered at that time. A right inguinal herniorrhaphy and hydrocelectomy had been performed six and a half years before admission. The patient is allergic to amoxicillin.
medical_history.family_history: A maternal uncle had cancer of the tongue. Parents and a sibling were well.
